intro: Kokoona ochracea, commonly known as the yellow kokoona, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, adding a splash of color to its harsh environment. Kokoona ochracea is adapted to survive in dry conditions, storing water in its thick leaves and stems. It is often found growing on rocky outcrops and in sandy soils, showcasing its resilience to extreme climates.
